Whoa, oh, I never realized what a kiss could be
 This could only happen to me
 Can’t you see, can’t you see

They sure don’t incorporate kisses into songs today the way they used to! Songs like “This Magic Moment” by The Drifters, or “It’s In His Kiss” written by Rudy Clark are dedicated to the power of the kiss and even through all of the sex, drugs, and rock n' roll, they served to show the romantic naivety found in american culture during times of much heavier censorship than our own.

I should have known better with a girl like you
 That I would love everything that you do
 And I do, hey, hey, hey, and I do

This song opens with some forceful Dylanesque harmonica that was present in their earlier songs like “Love Me Do”, “From Me To You” and “Please, Please Me”. Unfortunately, the band soon retired the harmonica for the most part.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lhPvtDDxEV0

The narrator almost seems regretful for how utterly and hopelessly in love he is with the object of his desire. This whole song is an ode to love’s rapture.
